contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{cleanup|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox garden |name =Kalindi Kunj |image = |image size = |alt = |caption = |type = |location = [[Delhi]] |coordinates = |size = |plants = |species = |collections = |opened = |owner = |operator = |budget = |visitors = |status = |website = }} '''Kalindi Kunj''' is a [[public garden]] in [[Delhi]], located on the banks of [[River Yamuna]], close to [[Okhla]] [[Barrage (dam)|barrage]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.india9.com/i9show/Kalindi-Kunj-48215.htm|title=Kalindi Kunj|publisher=india9}}</ref> Named after ''Kalindi'', another name of river and goddess [[Yamuna]] and is situated close to between [[Delhi]] and [[Noida]] ([[Uttar Pradesh]]) border, it also accessible to [[Faridabad]] in [[Haryana]], via [[Mathura Road]]. The nearest residential colony in Delhi is Shahin Bagh, Jamia Nagar, Jasola & [[Sarita Vihar]]. Kalindi Kunj has extensive manicured lawns and fountains that are turned on only in the evenings. The park was created by engineer S. S. Agarwal and his group. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://wikimapia.org/5670397/Kalindi-Kunj-Park Kalindi Kunj Park] at ''[[wikimapia]]'' {{coord missing|Delhi}} [[Category:Parks in Delhi]] [[Category:Gardens in India]] {{Delhi-geo-stub}}
